column1: BC Assessment Building Information Report Data Element Description

column3: Description
Administrative areas, within BC Assessment.
Municipal and rural jurisdictions, as defined by BCA.
Location of a property.
Unique ID (assigned by BCA) for parcels and their improvements.
Unique ID (assigned by LTSA) for a parcel of land in BC.
Legal attributes of a property owner’s assessment notices.
column4: Lot 5 Plan KAP14723 District Lot 31 Land District 27

column3: The type of measure used to record land dimension.
The size of a land parcel.
The depth of the land parcel.
Total assessed value of the land associated with the roll number.
Total assessed value of all improvements associated with the roll number.
Sum of total assessed land value and improvements associated with the roll number.
The year that construction began on the property.
The age of a property’s recent improvement(s).
Indicates building type.
State & condition of a building and its structural components.
Denotes the primary purpose that a folio is being used for.
The categories of like improvements within an associated Competitive Market Set.
Denotes type of strata units present in building.
The number of strata units in a building, or a given type.
Total area of a building, not including foundation area
The size of the Basement, Slab and/or Crawl space areas.
The area of a given strata unit.
The total constructed area of a building. It includes all enclosed floor areas of the building including basements, mechanical rooms etc.
The gross area of a single floor, less common areas and major vertical penetrations (e.g. ventilation shaft, elevator shafts & stairs).
The total floor area designed for the occupancy and exclusive use of tenants (aka. “Store area”), excluding common areas.
